title: Lists (Arrays)
concept: This level focuses on handling lists in Python: indexing, iteration, summing values, filtering even/odd, searching, counting occurrences, reversing and frequency operations.

challenges.title: Sum of List
challenges.description: Read N and then N integers. Print their sum.
challenges.inputDescription: N then N integers separated by space.
challenges.starterCode:
n = int(input())
arr = list(map(int, input().split()))
# compute and print sum

challenges.title: Maximum Element
challenges.description: Read N and a list of N integers. Print the largest element.
challenges.starterCode:
n = int(input())
arr = list(map(int, input().split()))
# print max

challenges.title: Minimum Element
challenges.description: Print the smallest number in the list.
challenges.starterCode:
n = int(input())
arr = list(map(int, input().split()))
# find minimum

challenges.title: Search Element
challenges.description: Read N list elements and X. Print Yes if X is present, else No.
challenges.inputDescription: N, list of N integers, and integer X.
challenges.starterCode:
n = int(input())
arr = list(map(int, input().split()))
x = int(input())
# search x

challenges.title: Count Occurrences
challenges.description: Print how many times X occurs in the list.
challenges.inputDescription: N, list of N integers, then X.
challenges.starterCode:
n = int(input())
arr = list(map(int, input().split()))
x = int(input())
# count x

challenges.title: Sum of Even Numbers
challenges.description: Sum only the even numbers in the list.
challenges.starterCode:
n = int(input())
arr = list(map(int, input().split()))
# sum evens

challenges.title: Reverse Print
challenges.description: Print the list elements in reverse order separated by spaces.
challenges.starterCode:
n = int(input())
arr = list(map(int, input().split()))
# print in reverse

challenges.title: Second Largest
challenges.description: Print the second largest distinct number.
challenges.starterCode:
n = int(input())
arr = list(map(int, input().split()))
# find 2nd largest

challenges.title: Sorted or Not
challenges.description: If the list is sorted in non-decreasing order print Yes else No.
challenges.inputDescription: N then list of N integers.
challenges.starterCode:
n = int(input())
arr = list(map(int, input().split()))
# check if sorted

challenges.title: Digit Frequency (0-9)
challenges.description: Given N numbers (each 0–9), count frequency of each digit and print in format d:x for 0 to 9.
challenges.starterCode:
n = int(input())
arr = list(map(int, input().split()))
# freq count 0-9
